reviews.title: Excellent informal bar/bistro with great food and service
reviews.text: The Bridge 1815 within the Waterloo Hotel is a relaxing, informal venue for a drink, snack or meal. We drop in most weekends and are always impressed by the great , friendly service, locally sourced food and drink and the location is lovely. The Waterloo constantly changes to meet customers' expectations, it's the best place in town!
We stayed in the family chalet (two adults and one child) and enjoyed a relaxing and pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The staff are very welcoming and the food was excellent. The pool and gym which hotel guests have included access to is an added bonus.
reviews.title: Breathtaking !

reviews.text: IIf you're looking for a great hotel to stay in for a quiet weekend away then this is it.
reviews.title: Family Chalet Room in Betws-Y-Coed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for only one night, in the chalets front facing the main hotel. With french doors out to a garden area, with your own table and chairs, great if the sun is shining to relax and listen to the sounds of nature.
reviews.title: Lovely break
Snowdonia National Park
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel late at night after our trek up snowdon. The staff were very accomodating, nothing was too much trouble, given the late hour. There was so much choice for breakfast, you could even have something specially cooked.

reviews.title: MOTELS ARE STILL ALIVE AND WELL IN NORTH WALES!
reviews.text: The evening meal in the restaurant was very good value.

reviews.title: Great location and perfect for a brief visit to Snowdonia
reviews.text: Spa/Gym very modern and open long hours.

reviews.title: Friendly, helpful staff, spacious room, nice size indoor pool.
reviews.text: Overall a very welcoming hotel to stay at with a great location. We will return.

reviews.title: amazing stay
reviews.text: Until I stayed at the Waterloo Hotel I thought that motels were a rarity in our country. Seemingly not so if Betws-y-coed is anything to go by! We were allocated a chalet-type room consisting of a large bedroom and a bathroom. The car could be parked right outside the door to the chalet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: lovely relaxing weekend, service very good, only criticism the beds were a bit hard
reviews.title: weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed, they are all being refurbished to a high standard, the beds are so comfortable, the rooms are spacious and clean, the reception staff are lovely and polite and do everything to try and make your stay perfect. The pool is a fair size. Pool jacuzzi is good but all though it states children below a certain age are not allowed in this due to health and safetey, the pool staff do not ensure this happens, so you can find young children messing around in it. I would recommend this hotel, as it is in a beautiful, peaceful setting and the breakfast is lovely too.
reviews.title: Waterloo Hotel (Best Western)

reviews.text: Stayed here with my 4-yr old in October half term. Very friendly staff and good service in restaurant and at breakfast.
reviews.title: Good pool, great rooms, friendly staff

reviews.text: The room was nice - a lodge style room out the back, with a separate lounge and sleeping areas (not completely divided, just a low internal wall between). Would easily sleep 4 in comfort. Small garden accessed through patio doors. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: excellent all round

reviews.text: Pool/leisure centre was excellent; its a private gym free to hotel residents. Pool was a reasonable size and there was a small childrens' pool as well; we were only there for 16 hrs but went to the pool twice.
reviews.title: Excellent for visiting Snowdonia in comfort

reviews.text: Stayed here in January this year, and found out that even in the luxury lodges they only have Freeview on the TV with just 3 extra digital channels on top of Channels 1-5.
reviews.title: Don't stay in the winter if you like watching lots of Freeview channels

reviews.text: There is not a lot to do in the night time in Snowdonia, so we like to watch TV, and my mother and me would have really appreciated knowing before we booked, that they didn't receive the amount of channels that we get in Cheshire. When quoted at 112 pounds a night for a luxury lodge, you would expect Sky TV for that money.
reviews.title: Lovely stay over New Year

reviews.text: If you're not into your TV, it's an alright place to stay, and the spa facilities are ok.
reviews.title: Ok, but could have been better.

reviews.text: After staying at the Stables Lodge for three nights we stayed at the Waterloo for two nights in one of the chalets with our two children, aged 9 and 11. The arrangement was very good as they had their own room (we had a separate bedroom and they slept in a lounge style room with sofa bed easily converted into a bed). The decoration was modern and comfortable even though the chalets look a bit miserable from the outside. We also really liked the pool and spa facilities, the gym also looks good even though we did not use it. We had a bit of a struggle with the TV (the remote did not work) and the WiFi is not brilliant. No complaints about the breakfast, we also had an evening meal which was good quality, just a little pricey (but no more than most of the other restaurants in the area). Betws y Coed we thoroughly enjoyed, even though it rained non stop!
reviews.title: Not bad for a base to explore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed B&B in one of the lodges separate from the hotel. Clean, comfortable and warm, but clanking water pipes after using water, wi-fi connected outside room but not inside, strange tv remote with no control of sub titles etc. Buffet style breakfast but items were running out 30 mins before closing. We, and others had to wait for more to come from the kitchen. Plenty of parking. Easy walk to everything in Betws.
reviews.title: Do not judge a book by it's cover
